author: sky.cactus
content: Should miners be allowed to *not* accept the full gas_premium?  The python code I have asserts that the miner received the full gas premium, but in theory if a miner wanted to craft a lock where they didn't extract the full premium I don't see a strong reason that should result in an invalid block.

author: sky.cactus
content: I do think that the logic for "miners **MUST** receive the calculated `premium_per_gas`" is simpler for validation, so if no one has a strong opinion that miners should be able to *reject* the premium then I would prefer to keep the logic such that it requires miners to take the premium.

author: sky.cactus
content: I would still like to rename (colloquially) `gas_premium` to `maximum_miner_bribe`.  Not a consensus change, though I do think there is value in all of the clients using shared terminology which is why I bring it up here.

author: sky.cactus
content: I think `maximum_miner_bribe` is a bit more clear to users, and I suspect that the variable names that clients use will likely end up being what end-users use colloquially, so picking something easy for end-users to understand is valuable IMO.

author: sky.cactus
content: To anyone not subscribed to the GitHub issue, I have updated my PR to include a rewrite of the abstract, to see if that addresses the concerns some people have expressed over there not being a good plain English description of the new fee system.  Definitely open to feedback, though I intentionally am leaving the specific formulas for the specification as I don't think people should be trying to implement from the abstract.
